intro: Knautia dominii, commonly known as the Balkan knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and upright. Knautia dominii is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
